p: As shown in Figure 4, when IOP was added to MG-63 cells and U2OS cells at different concentrations (80 μg/mL, 160 μg/mL, and 320 μg/mL) compared with the control group, the invasive ability of the cells was significantly reduced in the 80 μg/mL, 160 μg/mL, and 320 μg/mL groups ( P < 0.05). And this inhibition of cell invasion by the treatment of IOP was in a concentration-dependent manner. This result indicates that IOP can inhibit the invasion of osteosarcoma cells.
